Here are some recommendations based on your preference cues:
- "It's a Wonderful Life" (1946) directed by Charles Capra. This classic film tells the story of George Bailey (Sheldon Leonard), an ordinary man who is about to commit suicide after being overwhelmed by the responsibilities and worries that he has accumulated over the course of his life. Despite feeling as though nothing in his life could possibly have any good or positive outcome for him, George still decides to go through with committing suicide after all. But just before George can finally pull out the trigger on his gun and commit suicide after all, George suddenly gets a very strong and urgent urge to go see his brother Harry Bailey (Frank Faylen) who is living in a different city than where George is living in.
